roleset.name: reduce, reduction
roleset.note: CURB-V NOTES: I don't really expect the higher-numbered args to appear, but they'rethere for reference. Neither do I expect the sense of "please curbyour dog". (from curb.01-v)
CURB-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on curb.01, WN eventive noun lexicon. Corresponds to VNcls subjugate-42.3. (from curb.01-n)

roles.note: arg 3, 4 expected to be rare, if even occuring. (from curb.01-n)

role.descr: End point, end state of arg1

example.name: typical usage
example.text: [The CFTC]-1 plans *trace*-1 to curb dual trading on commodities markets, in which traders buy and sell both for their own account and for clients.
example.arg: dual trading on commodities markets , in which traders buy and sell both for their own account and for clients

example.name: arg0, 1
example.text: Voices on the WTO's ruling against China on its curb of raw material exports.

example.name: arg1
example.text: We didn't pay attention to the headaches we got, they were normal-seeming, and the curb of appetite might have been from our periods
